allOf.description: Start allocating ports at this value, going downward

replication.description: Setup this mariadb as a replica of another mariadb

upstream-mariadb-url.description: URL of the primary mariadb to replicate from

upstream-bootstrap-url.description: URL of a recent mariadb backup to bootstrap replication from

upstream-caucased-url.description: URL of the caucased server of the primary mariadb to request certificates from

seconds-behind-master-threshold.description: Monitoring threshold for Seconds_Behind_Master in the replica, in seconds, -1 meaning no threshold

allow-tcp-connections-on-replica.description: Whether a replica should allow TCP connections

caucased.description: Use a caucased server to obtain certificates for mTLS. Remote services can obtain certificates by pasting their CSRs here.

enable.description: Enable an embedded caucased server running inside the mariadb partition

csr-to-sign.description: PEM-encoded string representing one or more CSRs to be signed by this caucased server

ipv6-reverse-proxy.description: Grant IPv6 access to mariadb via a reverse-proxy. Requires caucase for mTLS.

enable.description: Enable IPv6 reverse-proxy. Always disabled when no (embedded or external) caucased server is provided.

database-list.description: Databases to create and respective user credentials getting all privileges on it

periodicity.description: When to backup, specified in the same format as for systemd.time(7) calendar events (years & seconds not supported, DoW & DoM cannot be combined).

retention-days.description: How many day backups must be retained, 0 meaning forever

periodicity.description: When to SQL-dump, overriding the global backup periodicity

retention-days.description: How many days SQL dumps must be retained, overriding the global backup retention value

periodicity.description: When to mariabackup, overriding the global backup periodicity

retention-days.description: How many days mariabackups must be retained, overriding the global backup retention value
How many days binlogs must be retained, overriding the global backup retention value

long-query-time.description: Number of seconds above which long queries are logged

max-connection-count.description: See MariaDB documentation on max_connections. If not provided, a value suitable for the number of request Zope processes is chosen.

relaxed-writes.description: When enabled, sets innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit = 0, innodb_flush_method = nosync, innodb_doublewrite = 0 and sync_frm = 0 - RTFM, those options are dangerous

ssl.description: Enable and define SSL support for network connections

ca-crt.description: Certificate Authority's certificate, in PEM format

crt.description: Server's certificate, in PEM format (mandatory to enable SSL support)

key.description: Server's key, in PEM format (mandatory to enable SSL support)

crl.description: Server's certificate revocation list, in PEM format

cipher.description: Permissible cipher specifications, separated by colons

odbc-ini.description: Contents of odbc.ini file, see unixodbc document

environment-variables.description: Extra environment variables for mysqld may be required to use third party ODBC libraries for CONNECT storage engine.
